intro: Rubus × thuillieri, commonly known as the blackberry raspberry or thimbleberry, is a hybrid shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that range in color from red to black, depending on the variety. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and agricultural settings.
